name: Statistical Methods for Machine Learning II
description: Probabilistic foundations of supervised and unsupervised learning methods such as naive Bayes, mixture models, and logistic regression. Gradient-based fitting of composite models including neural nets. Exact inference, stochastic variational inference, and Marko chain Monte Carlo. Variational autoencoders and generative adversarial networks.
prerequisites: STA314H1/CSC411H1 (beginning Fall 2019), STA302H1, CSC108H1/CSC120H1/CSC121H1/CSC148H1, MAT235Y1/MAT237Y1/MAT257Y1, MAT223H1/MAT240H1
